verses.kjv: Now when all this was finished, all Israel that were present went out to the cities of Judah, and brake the images in pieces, and cut down the groves, and threw down the high places and the altars out of all Judah and Benjamin, in Ephraim also and Manasseh, until they had utterly destroyed them all. Then all the children of Israel returned, every man to his possession, into their own cities.
verses.web: Now when all this was finished, all Israel who were present went out to the cities of Judah, and broke the pillars in pieces, cut down the Asherah poles, and broke down the high places and the altars out of all Judah and Benjamin, also in Ephraim and Manasseh, until they had destroyed them all. Then all the children of Israel returned, every man to his possession, into their own cities.
verses.ct: When the celebration was over, all the Israelites who had been there went out to the cities of Judah and smashed the sacred pillars, chopped down the Asherah poles, and tore down the high places and altars throughout Judah, Benjamin, Ephraim, and Manasseh until every last one was destroyed. Then everyone returned to their own cities and properties.

verses.kjv: And Hezekiah appointed the courses of the priests and the Levites after their courses, every man according to his service, the priests and Levites for burnt offerings and for peace offerings, to minister, and to give thanks, and to praise in the gates of the tents of the LORD.
verses.web: Hezekiah appointed the divisions of the priests and the Levites after their divisions, every man according to his service, both the priests and the Levites, for burnt offerings and for peace offerings, to minister, to give thanks, and to praise in the gates of LORD’s camp.
verses.ct: Hezekiah organized the priests and Levites into their divisions, assigning each person to their specific role — whether offering burnt offerings and peace offerings, leading worship, giving thanks, or praising God at the gates of the LORD's temple.

verses.kjv: He appointed also the king’s portion of his substance for the burnt offerings, to wit, for the morning and evening burnt offerings, and the burnt offerings for the sabbaths, and for the new moons, and for the set feasts, as it is written in the law of the LORD.
verses.web: He also appointed the king’s portion of his possessions for the burnt offerings, for the morning and evening burnt offerings, and the burnt offerings for the Sabbaths, for the new moons, and for the set feasts, as it is written in LORD’s law.
verses.ct: He also contributed from his own wealth to fund the burnt offerings — the morning and evening sacrifices, the Sabbath offerings, the new moon offerings, and all the offerings for the appointed festivals, just as the law of the LORD requires.

verses.kjv: Moreover he commanded the people that dwelt in Jerusalem to give the portion of the priests and the Levites, that they might be encouraged in the law of the LORD.
verses.web: Moreover he commanded the people who lived in Jerusalem to give the portion of the priests and the Levites, that they might give themselves to LORD’s law.
verses.ct: On top of that, he ordered the people living in Jerusalem to provide the share that belonged to the priests and Levites, so they could devote themselves fully to the law of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And as soon as the commandment came abroad, the children of Israel brought in abundance the firstfruits of corn, wine, and oil, and honey, and of all the increase of the field; and the tithe of all things brought they in abundantly.
verses.web: As soon as the commandment went out, the children of Israel gave in abundance the first fruits of grain, new wine, oil, honey, and of all the increase of the field; and they brought in the tithe of all things abundantly.
verses.ct: As soon as the order went out, the Israelites responded generously, bringing huge quantities of the first fruits of their grain, new wine, olive oil, honey, and everything else their fields produced. They also brought in a full tithe of everything — and it was an enormous amount.

verses.kjv: And concerning the children of Israel and Judah, that dwelt in the cities of Judah, they also brought in the tithe of oxen and sheep, and the tithe of holy things which were consecrated unto the LORD their God, and laid them by heaps.
verses.web: The children of Israel and Judah, who lived in the cities of Judah, also brought in the tithe of cattle and sheep, and the tithe of dedicated things which were consecrated to LORD their God, and laid them in heaps.
verses.ct: The people of Israel and Judah who lived in the towns of Judah also brought in a tithe of their cattle and sheep, along with a tithe of the holy things that had been dedicated to the LORD their God. They piled it all up in heaps.

verses.kjv: In the third month they began to lay the foundation of the heaps, and finished them in the seventh month.
verses.web: In the third month they began to lay the foundation of the heaps, and finished them in the seventh month.
verses.ct: The heaps started growing in the 3rd month and weren't finished until the 7th month.

verses.kjv: And when Hezekiah and the princes came and saw the heaps, they blessed the LORD, and his people Israel.
verses.web: When Hezekiah and the princes came and saw the heaps, they blessed LORD and his people Israel.
verses.ct: When Hezekiah and his officials came and saw the massive piles, they praised the LORD and blessed his people Israel.

verses.kjv: Then Hezekiah questioned with the priests and the Levites concerning the heaps.
verses.web: Then Hezekiah questioned the priests and the Levites about the heaps.
verses.ct: Hezekiah asked the priests and Levites about the heaps.

verses.kjv: And Azariah the chief priest of the house of Zadok answered him, and said, Since the people began to bring the offerings into the house of the LORD, we have had enough to eat, and have left plenty: for the LORD hath blessed his people; and that which is left is this great store.
verses.web: Azariah the chief priest, of the house of Zadok, answered him and said, “Since people began to bring the offerings into LORD’s house, we have eaten and had enough, and have plenty left over, for LORD has blessed his people; and that which is left is this great store.”
verses.ct: Azariah the chief priest, from the family of Zadok, answered him, "Ever since the people started bringing their offerings to the LORD's temple, we've had more than enough to eat, with plenty left over. The LORD has blessed his people so richly that all of this is what remains."

verses.kjv: Then Hezekiah commanded to prepare chambers in the house of the LORD; and they prepared them,
verses.web: Then Hezekiah commanded them to prepare rooms in LORD’s house, and they prepared them.
verses.ct: Hezekiah then ordered that storerooms be prepared in the LORD's temple, and they got them ready.

verses.kjv: And brought in the offerings and the tithes and the dedicated things faithfully: over which Cononiah the Levite was ruler, and Shimei his brother was the next.
verses.web: They brought in the offerings, the tithes, and the dedicated things faithfully. Conaniah the Levite was ruler over them, and Shimei his brother was second.
verses.ct: The people faithfully brought in their offerings, tithes, and dedicated gifts. Conaniah the Levite was put in charge of all of it, with his brother Shimei as his second-in-command.

verses.kjv: And Jehiel, and Azaziah, and Nahath, and Asahel, and Jerimoth, and Jozabad, and Eliel, and Ismachiah, and Mahath, and Benaiah, were overseers under the hand of Cononiah and Shimei his brother, at the commandment of Hezekiah the king, and Azariah the ruler of the house of God.
verses.web: Jehiel, Azaziah, Nahath, Asahel, Jerimoth, Jozabad, Eliel, Ismachiah, Mahath, and Benaiah were overseers under the hand of Conaniah and Shimei his brother, by the appointment of Hezekiah the king and Azariah the ruler of God’s house.
verses.ct: Serving under Conaniah and Shimei as supervisors were Jehiel, Azaziah, Nahath, Asahel, Jerimoth, Jozabad, Eliel, Ismachiah, Mahath, and Benaiah. They were all appointed by King Hezekiah and Azariah, the chief official of God's temple.

verses.kjv: And Kore the son of Imnah the Levite, the porter toward the east, was over the freewill offerings of God, to distribute the oblations of the LORD, and the most holy things.
verses.web: Kore the son of Imnah the Levite, the gatekeeper at the east gate, was over the free will offerings of God, to distribute LORD’s offerings and the most holy things.
verses.ct: Kore son of Imnah, a Levite who served as gatekeeper at the East Gate, was in charge of the freewill offerings given to God. His job was to distribute the LORD's offerings and the most holy things.

verses.kjv: And next him were Eden, and Miniamin, and Jeshua, and Shemaiah, Amariah, and Shecaniah, in the cities of the priests, in their set office, to give to their brethren by courses, as well to the great as to the small:
verses.web: Under him were Eden, Miniamin, Jeshua, Shemaiah, Amariah, and Shecaniah, in the cities of the priests, in their office of trust, to give to their brothers by divisions, to the great as well as to the small;
verses.ct: Working under him in the cities assigned to the priests were Eden, Miniamin, Jeshua, Shemaiah, Amariah, and Shecaniah. They were trusted to distribute shares fairly to their fellow priests by division — to the young and old alike.

verses.kjv: Beside their genealogy of males, from three years old and upward, even unto every one that entereth into the house of the LORD, his daily portion for their service in their charges according to their courses;
verses.web: in addition to those who were listed by genealogy of males, from three years old and upward, even everyone who entered into LORD’s house, as the duty of every day required, for their service in their offices according to their divisions;
verses.ct: This was in addition to all the males 3 years old and older who were registered in the genealogies — everyone who came to the LORD's temple for their daily duties, serving in their assigned roles according to their divisions.

verses.kjv: Both to the genealogy of the priests by the house of their fathers, and the Levites from twenty years old and upward, in their charges by their courses;
verses.web: and those who were listed by genealogy of the priests by their fathers’ houses, and the Levites from twenty years old and upward, in their offices by their divisions;
verses.ct: The priests were registered by their family lines, and the Levites 20 years old and older were registered by their duties and divisions.

verses.kjv: And to the genealogy of all their little ones, their wives, and their sons, and their daughters, through all the congregation: for in their set office they sanctified themselves in holiness:
verses.web: and those who were listed by genealogy of all their little ones, their wives, their sons, and their daughters, through all the congregation; for in their office of trust they sanctified themselves in holiness.
verses.ct: The registrations also included all their dependents — their small children, wives, sons, and daughters — the whole community. Because of the trust placed in them, these men had set themselves apart as holy.

verses.kjv: Also of the sons of Aaron the priests, which were in the fields of the suburbs of their cities, in every several city, the men that were expressed by name, to give portions to all the males among the priests, and to all that were reckoned by genealogies among the Levites.
verses.web: Also for the sons of Aaron the priests, who were in the fields of the pasture lands of their cities, in every city, there were men who were mentioned by name, to give portions to all the males among the priests, and to all who were listed by genealogy among the Levites.
verses.ct: As for the descendants of Aaron — the priests living on the pasturelands around their cities — men were specifically designated by name in every town to distribute shares to every male among the priests and to everyone registered in the Levite genealogies.

verses.kjv: And thus did Hezekiah throughout all Judah, and wrought that which was good and right and truth before the LORD his God.
verses.web: Hezekiah did so throughout all Judah; and he did that which was good, right, and faithful before LORD his God.
verses.ct: Hezekiah carried out these reforms throughout all of Judah. Everything he did was good, right, and faithful before the LORD his God.

verses.kjv: And in every work that he began in the service of the house of God, and in the law, and in the commandments, to seek his God, he did it with all his heart, and prospered.
verses.web: In every work that he began in the service of God’s house, in the law, and in the commandments, to seek his God, he did it with all his heart, and prospered.
verses.ct: In every project he undertook for God's temple, in following the law and the commandments, and in seeking his God, he threw his whole heart into it — and he prospered.
